unconcealed, true, true in fact, worthy of credit, truthful.

34.brief: I send forth, send, send away, dismiss
34.long: I send forth, send (as a messenger, commission, etc.), send away, dismiss.
a thing spoken, (a) a word or saying of any kind, as command, report, promise, (b) a thing, matter, business.
(I talk, chatter in classical Greek, but in NT a more dignified word) I speak, say.

34.brief: from out, out from among, from
34.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
a measure, whether lineal or cubic; a measuring rod.
I offer, give; I put, place.

35.long: I love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem.

35.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
35.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
I offer, give; I put, place.

35.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
35.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

36.long: I believe, have faith in, trust in; pass: I am entrusted with.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

36.brief: but, on the other hand, and
36.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
I disobey, rebel, am disloyal, refuse conformity.
I see, look upon, experience, perceive, discern, beware.
life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence.
I remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await.

36.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at
36.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.

36.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
36.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
